Package blackjack

Class Deck

java.lang.Object
blackjack.Deck
public class Deck extends Object
Represents a standard deck of playing cards used in a Blackjack game. The deck consists of 52 cards, and includes methods for shuffling, dealing, and retrieving the current state of the deck.
Author:
Eli L

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private ArrayList<Card>
    deck
    The internal list representing the current state of the deck.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Deck()
    Constructs a new shuffled deck of 52 cards and removes the top card (burn card).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

    Deals (removes and returns) the top card from the deck.
    private ArrayList<Card>
    fillDeck()
    Generates a new list of 52 cards (13 cards per suit).
    ArrayList<Card>
    getDeck()
    Returns the current state of the deck (mostly for debugging or inspection).

    Shuffles the deck using the Fisher-Yates algorithm.

  • Field Details

    • deck

      private ArrayList<Card> deck
      The internal list representing the current state of the deck.

  • Constructor Details

    • Deck

      public Deck()
      Constructs a new shuffled deck of 52 cards and removes the top card (burn card).

  • Method Details

    • fillDeck

      private ArrayList<Card> fillDeck()
      Generates a new list of 52 cards (13 cards per suit).
      Returns:
      a new ArrayList<Card> containing a full standard deck.

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      Shuffles the deck using the Fisher-Yates algorithm. Also removes the top card from the deck (burn card) after shuffling.

      This simulates a standard casino-style card burn after a shuffle.

    • deal

      public Card deal()
      Deals (removes and returns) the top card from the deck.
      Returns:
      the top Card from the deck.

    • getDeck

      public ArrayList<Card> getDeck()
      Returns the current state of the deck (mostly for debugging or inspection).
      Returns:
      the ArrayList<Card> representing the remaining cards in the deck.
